title: Evaluating Multimodal Generative AI with Korean Educational Standards
author: Sanghee Park (NAVER Cloud AI), Geewook Kim (NAVER Cloud AI, KAIST AI), ...
relevance_why: This paper suggests a benchmark (KoNET) that evaluates models' capacities in multimodal tasks using Korean educational content, which can be applied to train better audio-visual models.
background: This paper presents a new benchmark for evaluating generative AI models based on the performance of Korean educational tests, which incorporates complex reasoning and multimodal inputs.
contribution: The paper introduces the Korean National Educational Test Benchmark (KoNET) to comprehensively assess multimodal generative AI systems using Korean language educational tests, revealing insights about model capabilities.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing benchmarks often focus on English or lack comparison with human performance.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work uniquely combines educational assessment with multimodal AI evaluation, focusing on Korean to fill a significant gap.

key_innovation: KoNET leverages rigorous educational standards and diverse question types to evaluate model performance in a comprehensive manner.
real_world_impact: This benchmark could significantly influence the development of educational AI tools, improving teaching methodologies and learning experiences, especially in Korean contexts.
limitations: While the benchmark addresses multimodal aspects, it primarily focuses on multiple-choice formats and lacks extensive subjective assessments.

new_terms.KoNET: **Korean National Educational Test Benchmark** is a newly introduced evaluation framework designed to measure the performance of AI models specifically on Korean educational standards.

open_sourcing: The code and dataset builder will be made fully open-sourced at https://github.com/naver-ai/KoNET.
